Deficiency Narrative: Several children in care admitted to going on a hunting trip where they were allowed to hold a real gun and pull the trigger.
Correction Narrative:
The following email was provided from administrator Earline Richburg: 

1.	Permanent Ban on Firearm-Related Activities
o	Triple 7 Ranch has permanently removed hunting or any firearm-related activity from its programs.

o	All staff have been formally notified of this change, and policy updates reflecting this prohibition have been implemented.

Triple 7 Ranch is committed to creating a safe, structured, and regulation-compliant environment for children in our care. We appreciate the guidance from HHSC and are dedicated to fully aligning our operations with Texas Administrative Code standards.

Deficiency Narrative: The staff that accompanied the children on the hunting trip left the children with staff from the hunting facility, while operation staff were in a different facility.
Correction Narrative:
2.	Enhanced Supervision Policies & Compliance
o	Mandatory Direct Supervision: Children will be supervised exclusively by Triple 7 Ranch staff at all times during off-site activities. No external staff will assume responsibility for our children. 
o	Updated Staff-to-Child Ratio Compliance: A 1:5 staff-to-child ratio will be enforced for all off-site activities. Logs and check-ins will be conducted to document compliance.
o	Strict Oversight for Higher-Risk Activities: Activities deemed high-risk will be reevaluated, and only pre-approved activities with strict supervision guidelines will be permitted.

Triple 7 Ranch is committed to creating a safe, structured, and regulation-compliant environment for children in our care. We appreciate the guidance from HHSC and are dedicated to fully aligning our operations with Texas Administrative Code standards.

Deficiency Narrative: The staff that accompanied the children to the hunting trip were not with the children while they were hunting deer, therefore ratio was not complaint.
Correction Narrative:
The following email was provided from administrator Earline Richburg: 
2.	Enhanced Supervision Policies & Compliance

o	Mandatory Direct Supervision: Children will be supervised exclusively by Triple 7 Ranch staff at all times during off-site activities. No external staff will assume responsibility for our children.
o	Mandatory Direct Supervision: Children will be supervised exclusively by Triple 7 Ranch staff at all times during off-site activities. No external staff will assume responsibility for our children.
o	Mandatory Direct Supervision: Children will be supervised exclusively by Triple 7 Ranch staff at all times during off-site activities. No external staff will assume responsibility for our children.

Triple 7 Ranch is committed to creating a safe, structured, and regulation-compliant environment for children in our care. We appreciate the guidance from HHSC and are dedicated to fully aligning our operations with Texas Administrative Code standards.

Deficiency Narrative: The children at the operation engage in treatment services, therefore they should not be allowed to use any firearms due to the children's behaviors and trauma, as this can pose a risk to the safety of children in care.
Correction Narrative:
The following email was provided from administrator Earline Richburg: 

Triple 7 Ranch takes compliance and child safety seriously and wants to clarify that while a hunting trip did take place, it was conducted at an external facility. However, we recognize that children were left under the supervision of hunting facility staff rather than being continuously monitored by our own personnel. We acknowledge this as a lapse in adherence to our own policies and HHSC regulations regarding supervision and the prohibition of firearms in child care environments.

o	Triple 7 Ranch has permanently removed hunting or any firearm-related activity from its programs.

o	All staff have been formally notified of this change, and policy updates reflecting this prohibition have been implemented.

Triple 7 Ranch is committed to creating a safe, structured, and regulation-compliant environment for children in our care. We appreciate the guidance from HHSC and are dedicated to fully aligning our operations with Texas Administrative Code standards.

Deficiency Narrative: The management staff did not provide the direct care staff that accompanied the children on the hunting trip the proper supervision requirements to ensure that the staff that were in charge of the children were properly supervising the children at all times.
Correction Narrative:
The following email was provided from administrator Earline Richburg: 
The following corrections were provided by email from administrator Earline Richburg: 
 4.	Stronger Management Oversight & Auditing
o	Mandatory Weekly Supervision Meetings: Direct care staff will meet with management to review compliance expectations and discuss any concerns.
o	Routine Audits & Compliance Spot Checks: Monthly audits and random checks will be conducted to ensure adherence to supervision, weapons policies, and child safety regulations.
o	Signed Compliance Acknowledgments: Staff will be required to sign updated policy acknowledgments to ensure accountability. Violations will result in immediate disciplinary action, including termination.

Triple 7 Ranch is committed to creating a safe, structured, and regulation-compliant environment for children in our care. We appreciate the guidance from HHSC and are dedicated to fully aligning our operations with Texas Administrative Code standards.

We welcome any additional recommendations and are available to discuss this matter further as needed.

Deficiency Narrative: The staff that accompanied the children on the hunting trip, were not supervising the children properly due to the children being with left with staff from the hunting grounds. The staff allowed the children to engage in high-risk activities by using firearms to hunt. Furthermore, the operations weapons policy states that no child may use a firearms during recreational activities.
Correction Narrative:
The following email was provided from administrator Earline Richburg: 

3.	Intensified Staff Training & Accountability

o	Annual Training on Weapons Policies: All staff will receive mandatory training on state regulations prohibiting firearm use by children in care.
o	Supervision & Risk Management Training: Staff will be retrained to reinforce prudent judgment, self-control, and strict supervision requirements.
o	Signed Compliance Acknowledgments: Staff will be required to sign updated policy acknowledgments to ensure accountability. Violations will result in immediate disciplinary action, including termination.

Triple 7 Ranch is committed to creating a safe, structured, and regulation-compliant environment for children in our care. We appreciate the guidance from HHSC and are dedicated to fully aligning our operations with Texas Administrative Code standards.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that the operation did not use prudent judgement when they picked up prescription medication for a child no longer in their care. The child was without medication for more than a day due to this. The operation also misplaced the child's cream and inhaler.
Correction Narrative:
1. Medication Protocol Enhancement:
A written policy has been issued clarifying that no staff shall accept or retrieve prescriptions for residents who are no longer in care at Triple 7 Ranch. In such cases, the pharmacy will be contacted to cancel or reroute the medication.

2. Medication Return Procedure:
If medications are received after a residents discharge, they will be returned to the pharmacy. The parent or receiving facility will be notified and guided to request the medication from a pharmacy local to their home or new placement.

3. Employee Training:
All staff have received updated training as of April 17, 2025, on prudent medication management and judgment in alignment with §748.507(1). A copy of this training module and attendance log is available for your review.

4. Medication Chain of Custody Log:
Effective immediately, a chain-of-custody log for all resident medication will be maintained and reconciled during intake and discharge to ensure accountability
.
5. Administrative Oversight:
An internal medication compliance audit will be conducted monthly, overseen by our LCCA, to ensure ongoing adherence.

Correction Narrative: The children have been removed from Triple 7 Ranch. T7R will only provide admission to children who we are permitted for now. Until we are able to change our permit license and add the additional services.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on interviews conducted and records reviewed, it was determined that children were not administered their medications on multiple days.
Correction Narrative:
5/29/2024-The operation's LCCA submitted to licensing staff the operation's Corrective Action Plan consisting of the operation's revised Medication Administration Protocol.  According to the operation's Medication Administration Protocol, staff administering medication must ensure they are focused and paying attention, staff are required to read the child's medication container and/or bottle label as well as medication form ensuring the information is the same, when administering medication to a child, staff must remember the five rights (right child, right medication, right dose, right time, right route), staff will maintain individual medication logs for each medication a child is being administered, when there is a medication error staff must contact health-care professional immediately as well as follow health-care professional's recommendations, all medication errors must be reported and documented immediately with the following information (time and date of error, name of medication, time and date of call to licensed health-care professional, name and title of health-care professional, and health-care recommendations for ensuring child's safety).

Additionally, staff must notify the Medication Technician or LCCA in the event an error on medication label or form is found.  Medication refills are required to be filled on time as well as psychiatric appointments must be scheduled, and child seen by doctor before mediation runs out. If there are refills on the prescription, staff are required to contact the pharmacy a week prior to medication running out.  For any reason there is a situation where the pharmacy cannot fill the prescription on time, staff must inform LCCA immediately.  The operation will utilize an office memorandum which will be placed in a child's file why and follow-up calls or emails documenting efforts were made to solve the problem.

LCCA indicated the operation's revised Medication Administration Protocol has been reviewed with staff ensuring staffs' responsibility to administer medication(s) to a child as prescribed.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on a review of medication administration records, it was found that medication logs were not completed properly.
Correction Narrative:
05/29/2024-The operation's LCCA submitted to licensing staff the operation's Corrective Action Plan consisting of Medication Form Training Certificates for all staff.  Each Medication Form Training Certificate reflected training was conducted on December 8, 2023, as well as the one hour and thirty-minute training was instructed by the LCCA.

Additionally, the operation's LCCA submitted the operation's revised Medication Log required information included in medication records consisting of the child's name, medication, medication dosage, directions on how to administer medication(s), reason medication was prescribed, medication time, amount of medication received, prescribing physician information, pharmacy information, date medication filled, date of expiration of medication, signature of person administering medication, medication date, amount of medication given to child, amount of medication remaining, comment section as well as quality check signature section ensuring an audit of medication logs by designated staff.

Lastly, the operation's LCCA submitted the operation's revised Medication Administration Protocol outlining steps taken in administering medication indicating each medication will have a medication log form for completion as well as each form will have important information that will match the information on medication container and/or bottle label.
